addressleaf.section:
To
e right honorable S
r
Robert Cecyll Knight of her Hig
es
privy Councel.

28 July 1595
M
r
Bodelie to S
r
Robert
Sidnie
Cecill.

page.lettertext:
fol.1r
May it please yo
r
H. to send me by this bearer
my Instructions, w
t
her
Hig
es
l
re
to
Co. Mau-
rice
, and to affourde me a worde unto my L.
T
re
r for two
pasportes
; one for posthorses, and
the other for passage of my stuffe, to
e serchers,
and bothe to be made for comming and going.
For I find sometimes,
at when I chance to
land in returnining in unusual places, where
I am unknowen, there is difficultie made to
serve my turne. If yo
r
H. have occasion to
use me in any thing, ether nowe or whensoever,
if yo
w
please to lette me knowe it, there shall
want no good endevo
rs
, to give yo
w
good con-
entment.
And so I take my humble leave.
July 28 95.
Yo
r
H. humble at commaundem
t
Tho. Bodley
Of S
r
Thomas Bodley (founder of
e famous library
at Oxford) & particularly his transactions with Count
Maurice, In Woods Ath: Oxon: p.327.
To S
r
Robert Cecyll PriviCounc
r
to Q. Elizabeth
